provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Gardens (Control)
    Regulations, 2008.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. No person shall, without lawful authority-
          (a) climb any tree, or walk on any border or flower bed in a public
              garden;
          (b) touch, cut or pick any flower, leaf, seed, fruit, twig or branch of a
              tree, or in any way injure any plant in the public garden; or
          (c) use the ornamental waters in any public garden for any purpose
              whatsoever.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Except with the written permission of the Superintendent of Public
    Gardens, no person shall, in a public garden, plant any flower, shrub, tree
    of any plant or sow or scatter any seed of any flower, shrub, tree or any
    plant.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4. No person shall, in a public garden, pollute or cause to be polluted any
    water in a river, stream, lake, pond, fountain or in any container.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Unless authorized in writing in that behalf by the Superintendent of
    Public Gardens, no person shall, in a public garden, sell or offer or expose
    for sale any flowers or plants or any article.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.--(I) No person, other than a person authorized by the Superintendent
    of Public Gardens and wearing an official badge evidencing his authority,
    shall approach any visitor to any public garden with an offer to serve
    as a guide in the garden.
â€¢           (2) No person shall molest or annoy any visitor to a public garden.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7.--( 1) No person shall-
          (a) remove from a public garden; or
          (b) in a public garden willfully disturb, ill-treat, injure or kill,
    any animal, bird, reptile or fish.
                    [The inclusion of this page is a u l h o W by L.N. 21R0121
              THE PUBLIC GARDENS (CONTROL)REGULATION, 2008
        (2) No person shall disturb, damage or destroy any egg of any
animal, bird; reptile or fish lawfully kept in the public garden.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. Every person having in his possession any bag, basket, parcel or
receptacle in a public garden shall, if so required, ,show the contents thereof
to a park keeper or a constable who reasonably suspects that the person has in
his possession any flower, leaf, seed, fruit, twig o: branch, cut or picked, in
breach of regulation 2.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9. Unless authorized in writing in that behalf by the Superintendent
of Public Gardens, no person shall hold any public meeting, deliver any
address, give any public performance, display or exhibition or otherwise con-
duct any public ceremony in a public garden.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. Subject to regulation, 11(2), no person shall-:
      (a) in a public garden, run, jog, play cricket, football, baseball,
          hockey, volleyball, netball or conduct any similar activity;
      (b) fly any model airplane or bring into, or use in any public garden,
          any equipment or apparatus therefor.     .

provisions.title: Section 11
provisions.content:
11.--(I) Subject to the provisions of regulation 9 and paragraph (2), no
person shall bring, cany or use any musical instrument, radio receiver or
television receiver within the limits of a public garden.
        (2) This regulation and regulation 10 shall not apply to radio
receivers to which earphones are fitted, nor to motor car radio receivers.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12. No person shall-
       (a) bring any dog or other animal within the limits of any public gar-
           den;
       (b). cause such dog or other animal to enter, within the limits of a
            public garden; or
       (c) cause a dog or other animal to trespass in a public garden.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. No person shall, in a public garden, willfully and unreasonably inter-
fere with the comfort of, or cause any annoyance to, any other person. .     '

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14. No person shall, in a public garden, solicit or accept any alms, dona-
tion, contribution or subscription of any kind.
    IS. No person shall, in a public' garden, throw or discharge any stone or
other missile or light any fire or fireworks.

provisions.title: Section 16
provisions.content:
16. No person shall, in a public garden-
       (a) deposit, throw down, or leave otherwise than in receptacles
           provided for that purpose, any bottle, tin, container, glass, paper
           or refuse of any kind;
                  [The incluion of this page is authorized by L.N. 21R0121
                  THE PUBLIC GARDENS (CONTROL)REGULATION, 2008
          (b) deposit, discharge or leave any noxious, noisome, offensive
              or polluting substance, matter or thing;
          (c) deposit or leave any offal, dead animal, dung or any filth;
          (d) deposit, throw down or leave in any receptacles any domestic
              garbage; and
          (e) willfi~llybreak any article of glass, china, pottery, plastic or brittle
              material.

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17.-(1) No person shall injure or deface, by writing or otherwise, any
    building, structure, statue, ornament, seat, wall, railing or thing in or
    enclosing any part of a public garden, or willfully damage or deface any
    lawn, road or path.
            (2) No person shall exhibit or affix any notice, advertisement or
    other written pictorial matter on any building, structure, statue, ornament,
    seat, wall, railing, or thing in or enclosing any part of a public garden
    except with the written permission of the Superintendent of Public
    Gardens.

provisions.title: Section 18
provisions.content:
18. Except with the prior written permission of the Superintendent
    of Public Gardens, no person shall, in a public garden, erect any stall, build-
    ing or any other structure.

provisions.title: Section 19
provisions.content:
19. Except with the prior written permission of the Superintendent of
    Public Gardens and having paid the fee determined by the Minister, no
    person shall take for commercial purposes, any footage of a public garden
    by means of photography, film, video, or any similar means.

provisions.title: Section 20
provisions.content:
20. No person shall, in a public garden, conduct himself in a disorderly or
    indecent manner or be indecently clothed.

provisions.title: Section 21
provisions.content:
21. No person shall, in a public garden, use any profane, indecent or
    obscene language.
       2 2 . 4 ) No person shall drive, ride or bring, as the case may be, any
    trucks, buses, cars, motor bikes, carts, drays or wagons into any public garden
    except on business connected with the garden.
            (2) Except along the public roadways, no person shall ride any
    bicycle within the limits of any public garden.
a      23. No person shall drive a vehicle within the limits of a public garden in
    excess of 15 kilometres per hour.

provisions.title: Section 24
provisions.content:
24. No person shall enter or leave any public garden otherwise than
    by the gates provided for entrance and exit respectively, and if so required
    by a park keeper or constable, a person shall leave the garden only
    by the gates specified by the park keeper or constable, as the case may
    be.
                   [The inclusion of this page is aulhorized by L.N. 21D012j
                                    -
              THE PUBLIC GARDENS(CONTR0L) REGUUTION, 2008

provisions.title: Section 25
provisions.content:
25. No visitor to a public garden shall enter or remain in the public
garden or any park, or zoo thereof after the time appointed for the closing
of the public garden or park, or while there is a notice therein stating
that the garden or park is closed.

provisions.title: Section 26
provisions.content:
26. Every person entering a public garden in any vehicle shall calise such
vehicle to be parked in the appropriate area designated for the parking
of vehicles.

provisions.title: Section 27
provisions.content:
27. A person who contravenes a provision of these Regulations commits
an offence and is liable on summary conviction in a Resident Magistrate's
Court to a fine not exceeding two hundred and fifty thousand dollars or to
imprisonment for a term not exceeding three months or to both such fine and
imprisonment.
